criticism: The mintToken function allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value, which can lead to integer overflow and potentially allow the owner to steal tokens from other users.
The transferFrom function allows a user to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value, which can lead to integer overflow and potentially allow the user to steal tokens from other users.
The buy function does not check the return value of msg.sender.send(), which can lead to a potential trap due to a potential integer overflow.
The sell function does not check the return value of msg.sender.send(), which can lead to a potential trap due to a potential integer overflow.
The transfer function allows asset theft due to incorrect access control for 'frozenAccount'.
